page.title: 06Ecology of Malhamdale
page.content: The block is on top of the Pennines and is therefore often very windy and rainy.The major rock-type of the area is limestone. The block is criss-crossed by footpaths,the main one being the { {Pennine Way}which runs parallel to the River Aire. There is little pollution in the block,since any drinking water is brought off the moors above Malham. {Supernatural in Malhamdale} {Kirkby Malham Church}reputedly has a ghost called the Grey Lady who sits in the back pew at midnight.There are also stories of the devil coming out of a dilapidated grave in the churchyard.In{Rose Cottage}in Kirkby Malham,16th century papers and balls were found during renovations.thought to be there to ward off any local spirits and witches.
